onetime.title: One time activity
onetime.description: Any one time work that a person or group does for the benefit of the organization

contribution.title: Generic Contribution
contribution.description: A payout for one time occurring expenses. Do not use this contribution for work done on projects or personal expenses and ensure the circle has agreed to cover these expenses.

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description: A payout for a role gap due to missed claims for periods between the old role expiring and the new role starting. Do not use the bridge if there is no new role that has been approved.

expense.title: Expense
expense.description: A payout for one time occurring expenses. Do not use this contribution for work done on projects or personal expenses and ensure the circle has agreed to cover these expenses.

queststart.title: Quest proposal
queststart.description: The first part of a quest is the initiation and confirmation to go ahead with a project. The quest proposal must be approved before a payout happens in the second step - the quest completion.

questend.title: Quest completion
questend.description: The second part of the quest is the completion. Propose this if your approved work from your quest proposal is done to request the payout.

agency.title: Agency
agency.description: Work done through an agency. This work must have a circle sponsor and the circle is responsible for the budget. It must have a representative from the agency in the DHO who is distributing the funds to the other members.

recurring.title: Recurring activity
recurring.description: Propose a recurring payout per cycle for doing regular work in a circle.

assignment.title: Role assignment
assignment.description: A role assignment is a set of activities based on an archetype. It can be revisited on a regular basis (e.g. every 3 month) and extended if the objectives and key results have been met.

deferred.label: Choose the deferred amount

badge.title: Badge assignment
badge.description: Pick this to apply for a badge and show people that you have a certain skill, perks, capabilities or general reputation.

rexpense.title: Recurring expense
rexpense.description: A payout for  recurring expenses. Do not use this contribution for work done on projects or personal expenses and ensure the circle has agreed to cover these expenses.

organization.title: Organization asset
organization.description: Any new asset being created that is affecting the organization as a whole.

policy.title: Policy
policy.description: A change of rules for the organization. Once a policy is approved, it must be executed and implemented per timetable. Use this type of contribution sparingly and only if it will cause harm for the organization otherwise.

strategy.title: Strategy
strategy.description: A (partial) strategy created by a circle and presented for member approval. If rejected, the originator must revise the strategy and provide an alternative approach. If approved, the circle must present the execution of the strategy to the anchor circle.

circle.title: Circle
circle.description: A new circle for the organization below the anchor circle. Do not propose sub-circle proposals as those will be handled by circles. Once approved, circles have budget responsibilities and must elect a Lamp Lighter to represent the circle.

archetype.title: Role archetype
archetype.description: Archetypes represent a recurrent symbol or pattern of the organization as a way to group certain kinds of activities together; they are a way to combine natural talents and strengths with the needs and capacities of the organization.
